amendatorysection.catchline: County funds; depositories; security in lieu of bond.
amendatorysection.para: In lieu of a bond as provided in sections 77-2316 to 77-2319, any bank, capital stock financial institution, or qualifying mutual financial institution making application to become a depository under sections 77-2312 to 77-2324 may give security as provided in the Public Funds Deposit Security Act to the county treasurer. Section 77-2366 shall apply to deposits in capital stock financial institutions. Section 77-2365.01 shall apply to deposits in qualifying mutual financial institutions.

crossreference.para: Public Funds Deposit Security Act, see section 77-2386.

annotation.para: Banks designated as depositories may pledge assets of bank to secure state and county funds when deposited therein. Bliss v. Pathfinder Irr. Dist., 122 Neb. 203, 240 N.W. 291 (1932).
Specification of certain assets which bank may pledge to secure repayment of county deposits is not a limitation on power to pledge others. Bliss v. Mason, 121 Neb. 484, 237 N.W. 581 (1931).
